availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert F. Colvin (Pendleton County Justice of the Peace)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Wright Colvin. Father of Nancy M. Colvin, Lewis W. Colvin, Benjamin F. Colvin, Sarah E. Colvin, and Robert H. Colvin. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Pendleton County in 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 363. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 24. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, Precinct 1, p. 48. Find A Grave, “Robert Forsythe Colvin (December 24, 1811-September 19, 1875)”, Memorial #116750058, http://findagrave.com/memorial/116750058 (accessed February 14, 2018). KYR-0001-004-1315.
